description: This notification is generated when a MPLS TE tunnel is
preempted.

event.Summary: MPLS TE tunnel $v3 operational status changed to $v2 because of $v4

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-MPLS-TE-STD-EXT-MIB::cmplsTunnelPreempt MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelAdminStatus i 1 MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelOperStatus i 1 MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelName s EXAMPLE CISCO-MPLS-TE-STD-EXT-MIB::cmplsTunnelPreemptionType i 1 CISCO-MPLS-TE-STD-EXT-MIB::cmplsTunnelPreemptionLinkAddrType i 0 CISCO-MPLS-TE-STD-EXT-MIB::cmplsTunnelPreemptionLinkAddr s EXAMPLE

description: Indicates the desired operational status of this
tunnel.
variables.name: MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelAdminStatus

description: Indicates the actual operational status of this
tunnel, which is typically but not limited to, a
function of the state of individual segments of
this tunnel.
variables.name: MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelOperStatus

description: The canonical name assigned to the tunnel. This name
can be used to refer to the tunnel on the LSR's
console port. If mplsTunnelIsIf is set to true
then the ifName of the interface corresponding to
this tunnel should have a value equal to
mplsTunnelName. Also see the description of ifName
in RFC 2863.
variables.name: MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelName

description: This object indicates LSP Preemption type of this LSP:
- unknown: the type is not known
- hardPreemption: the preempted LSP resources are
freed immediately; the LSP is broken immediately
and the traffic is disrupted.
- softPreemption: the resources release pending on the
reoptimization of this LSP. The head of the LSP
reroutes the traffic before the LSP is broken.
- frrSoftPreemption: similar to softPreemption. In this
case the traffic of the soft preempted LSP is switched to
the backup.
See: Farrel, A., Interim Report on MPLS Pre-emption
draft-farrel-mpls-preemption-interim-00.txt, work in progress
variables.name: CISCO-MPLS-TE-STD-EXT-MIB::cmplsTunnelPreemptionType

description: This object indicates the address type of the link where the
preemption occurs - another, higher priority LSP is being
admitted on this link and there is not enough bandwidth for it
causing this LSP to be preempted (removed) from this link:
- unknown: the object cmplsTunnelPreemptionLinkAddr does not
contain any address
- ipv4: the object cmplsTunnelPreemptionLinkAddr contains
the IPv4 address
- ipv6: the object cmplsTunnelPreemptionLinkAddr contains
the IPv6 address
variables.name: CISCO-MPLS-TE-STD-EXT-MIB::cmplsTunnelPreemptionLinkAddrType

description: This object indicates the address of the link where the
preemption occurs - another, higher priority LSP is being
admitted on this link and there is not enough bandwidth for it
causing this LSP to be preempted (removed) from this link.
variables.name: CISCO-MPLS-TE-STD-EXT-MIB::cmplsTunnelPreemptionLinkAddr

description: This notification is generated when a MPLS TE tunnel could not
be setup or reoptimized.

Summary.eval: ($v4==2) ? 'MPLS TE tunnel $v3 failed to be set up due to insufficient bandwidth' : (($v4==3) ? 'MPLS TE tunnel $v3 failed to be reoptimized due to insufficient bandwidth' : 'MPLS TE tunnel $v3 has insufficient bandwidth')

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-MPLS-TE-STD-EXT-MIB::cmplsTunnelInsuffBW MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelAdminStatus i 1 MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelOperStatus i 1 MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelName s EXAMPLE CISCO-MPLS-TE-STD-EXT-MIB::cmplsTunnelInsuffBWFailedOperation i 1

description: Indicates the desired operational status of this
tunnel.
variables.name: MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelAdminStatus

description: Indicates the actual operational status of this
tunnel, which is typically but not limited to, a
function of the state of individual segments of
this tunnel.
variables.name: MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelOperStatus

description: The canonical name assigned to the tunnel. This name
can be used to refer to the tunnel on the LSR's
console port. If mplsTunnelIsIf is set to true
then the ifName of the interface corresponding to
this tunnel should have a value equal to
mplsTunnelName. Also see the description of ifName
in RFC 2863.
variables.name: MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelName

description: This object indicates whether the tunnel could not be setup or
reoptimized because of insufficient bandwidth:
- unknown: the reason is not known
- failedToSetup: insufficient bandwidth during
initial setup
- failedToReoptimize: insufficient bandwidth during
reoptimization
variables.name: CISCO-MPLS-TE-STD-EXT-MIB::cmplsTunnelInsuffBWFailedOperation

description: This notification is generated when re-route is required
for the tunnel.

event.Summary: Tunnel $v3 requires re-route. Current operational state: $v2; Admin state: $v1

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-MPLS-TE-STD-EXT-MIB::cmplsTunnelReRoutePending MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelAdminStatus i 1 MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelOperStatus i 1 MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelName s EXAMPLE

description: Indicates the desired operational status of this
tunnel.
variables.name: MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelAdminStatus

description: Indicates the actual operational status of this
tunnel, which is typically but not limited to, a
function of the state of individual segments of
this tunnel.
variables.name: MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelOperStatus

description: The canonical name assigned to the tunnel. This name
can be used to refer to the tunnel on the LSR's
console port. If mplsTunnelIsIf is set to true
then the ifName of the interface corresponding to
this tunnel should have a value equal to
mplsTunnelName. Also see the description of ifName
in RFC 2863.
variables.name: MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelName

description: This notification is generated when tunnel no longer needs to
be re-routed.

Summary.eval: ($v4==2) ? 'Tunnel $v3 is reoptimized and no longer needs to be re-routed' : (($v4==3) ? 'Tunnel $v3 is reinstated and no longer needs to be re-routed' : 'Tunnel $v3 no longer needs to be re-routed')

objects.test: $SNMPTRAPCMD CISCO-MPLS-TE-STD-EXT-MIB::cmplsTunnelReRoutePendingClear MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelAdminStatus i 1 MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelOperStatus i 1 MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelName s EXAMPLE CISCO-MPLS-TE-STD-EXT-MIB::cmplsTunnelReRoutePendingClearReason i 1

description: Indicates the desired operational status of this
tunnel.
variables.name: MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelAdminStatus

description: Indicates the actual operational status of this
tunnel, which is typically but not limited to, a
function of the state of individual segments of
this tunnel.
variables.name: MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelOperStatus

description: The canonical name assigned to the tunnel. This name
can be used to refer to the tunnel on the LSR's
console port. If mplsTunnelIsIf is set to true
then the ifName of the interface corresponding to
this tunnel should have a value equal to
mplsTunnelName. Also see the description of ifName
in RFC 2863.
variables.name: MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelName

description: This object indicates the reason why the tunnel
is not longer in the reroute pending state:
- unknown: the reason is unknown
- reoptimized: the tunnel has been reoptimized
- reinstated: the tunnel has been reinstated
variables.name: CISCO-MPLS-TE-STD-EXT-MIB::cmplsTunnelReRoutePendingClearReason

description: This notification is generated when MPLS TE tunnel failed to
come up

event.Summary: MPLS tunnel $v1 failed to come up. Fail reason type: $v2

description: The canonical name assigned to the tunnel. This name
can be used to refer to the tunnel on the LSR's
console port. If mplsTunnelIsIf is set to true
then the ifName of the interface corresponding to
this tunnel should have a value equal to
mplsTunnelName. Also see the description of ifName
in RFC 2863.
variables.name: MPLS-TE-STD-MIB::mplsTunnelName

description: This object indicates the type (category) of fail reason.
variables.name: CISCO-MPLS-TE-STD-EXT-MIB::cmplsTeFailReasonType
